text: dear icebox cookies come out like this
flat on one side and not perfectly round
like these guys here I'm going to show
you some tricks that I've learned over
the years that will help to prevent that
flat side from happening and they're
super super simple
and you're gonna love them so I have
some cookie dough here this is a
pistachio shortbread but you can use any
icebox cookie recipe scrape this out
onto a piece of parchment paper and you
can use plastic wrap here if that's what
you have and just kind of shape the
dough into a long cylindrical shape and
what the parchment does here it's going
to act as a nice mat and it's going to
force the dough into a round shape and
if you have one of these on hand this is
a ruler you could use a bench scraper
anything with a flat straight edge so
take the flat edge of the ruler and push
it towards the dough and pull the bottom
of the parchment away from you and this
creates a nice rounded shape you can see
it's just kind of forcing the dough into
a nice cylinder it's kind of similar to
one of those sushi mats that you see in
Japanese restaurants so that is a really
nice shape and I'm just going to wrap it
up in the parchment because now we have
to chill the dough you have to let the
dough rest and get really nice and cold
so that we can slice it into perfectly
even coins now to go into the
refrigerator so it doesn't flatten out
as it cools if you have one of these on
hand these are really great it's just
your empty paper towel roll and just
snip down the center this creates a
little cradle or a nest for your cookie
dough so that doesn't flatten out on one
side and it will keep the cookie nice
and round in the refrigerator or you
could keep these in the freezer for
about three months I like to use a
little tape to kind of secure the shape
keeps it nice and tight and then this
goes into the freezer or refrigerator
until you're ready to slice it and bake
it so my dough is nice and chilled if
you are freezing your dough bring it out
a little bit so that it can kind of warm
up a little bit before you slice it
to it look at you can see how nice the
shape is and I'm going to cut this into
quarter inch coins and I like to use if
you have one of these knives it's a
santoku knife that's what it's called it
has a very thin blade which is perfect
for slicing cookies gently glide through
and you can see how perfectly even and
round your cookies stay when you use
this method and so you want to get these
into a preheated oven as quickly as you
can because you don't want the dough to
warm up too much otherwise they will
become misshapen
these willing for about ten or twelve
minutes for this recipe but always use
the times and temperatures in your
recipe and you will end up with
perfectly round delicious icebox cookies
